Articles.Content:
I've been around for some time and finally I registered.

So first things first; this is my introduction thread.

Hello and I answer any question you may have.

Lemme be the first to say: Welcome aboard!

So here's my question: What have you accomplished in the time before you came onto the forums? I'd love to see how you're doing

Lemme be the first to say: Welcome aboard!

So here's my question: What have you accomplished in the time before you came onto the forums? I'd love to see how you're doing

I've had little time to play so far, (that's one of the main reasons I've not logged in since yesterday) and I have to admit that I am useless at landing, so appart from a few cool supersonic airplanes, a nice set of comm satellites on geostationary orbit (I use RemoteTech) and 3 MIA trying to land on the Mun and Mimmus my space career have been... profitless.
I'm hopefully not going to start a flame war, but have you tried using MechJeb? I love it and it helps me accomplish a lot more than I have the patience to do.

I'm hopefully not going to start a flame war, but have you tried using MechJeb? I love it and it helps me accomplish a lot more than I have the patience to do.

Yes. I used it at the beginning to plan some dificult manouvers and so, but now I like to use it mostly for the tons of useful info it gives. Seriously, the surface alttitude, vertical speed, clear orbital information without having to constantly toggle between windows, and an endless etc.

I understand it can be challengeless to play with MechJeb planning and executing every single manouver node, but for such an Orbiter fan as I am, the intel he provides the game with is essential.
